CN.content:
Please identify the "Material Name" entities in the following paragraph.

Paragraph: It is also noteworthy that , the short circuit current of the devices increased with an increase in the number of perylene units in the polymer , except for the case of PFDTBT_20Per. Even though PFDTBT_20Per showed the highest hole mobility among the PFDTBT - based copolymers , it is UV - visible absorption spectrum showed greater blue - shifting than PFDTBT , as shown in Figures 2 and 3 , and it showed the widest band gap energy among all of the polymers considered herein. This may be why the short circuit current of the device fabricated using PFDTBT_20Per is lower than that of PFDTBT , despite it higher mobility. The device fabricated using PFDTBT-10Per showed the best photovoltaic performance among the PFDTBT - based polymers ( V oc = 0.74 V , J sc = 7.19 mA / cm^2 , PCE = 2.16% ). For the photovoltaic devices fabricated using PFD2TBT - based polymers , the shortcircuit currents of the devices also increased as the perylene content in the copolymers increased ; however , the PCEs of the devices using PFD2TBT - based polymers were lower than those of PFDTBT - based polymers because of lower open - circuit voltages and short - circuit currents. The device fabricated using PFD2TBT_10Per showed the highest PCE ( 1.51% ) among the PFD2TBT - based polymers. The characteristics of the ITO / 4. Figure 8 shows that the J-V characteristics of ITO / PEDOT : PSS / polymer : PC71BM / TiO x / Al devices provide a similar trend to those of ITO / PEDOT : PSS / polymer : PC71BM / LiF / Al devices but their PCEs increased mainly due to increased short circuit currents. The increase in the short circuit current originates from the introduction of the thin titanium suboxide ( TiO x ) layer ( ca. ∼ 10 nm ). The titanium suboxide layer could block holes to the aluminum electrode , thus it could increase the short circuit current of the photovoltaic device. The device fabricated using PFDTBT-10Per showed the highest PCE of 3.16% with an open circuit voltage of 0.81 V , a short circuit current of 9.61 mA / cm^2 and the highest fill factor ( 0.41 ) among the fabricated devices. The characteristics of the ITO / PEDOT : PSS / polymer : PC71BM / TiO x / Al devices are summarized in Table 5. Figure 9 shows the incident photon - to - current conversion efficiency ( IPCE ) spectra of the ITO / PEDOT : PSS / PFDTBT-10Per + PC71BM / LiF and TiO x / Al devices. The absorption onset corresponding to the photon - to - current conversion efficiency was about 750 nm for these devices , and the absorption onset values corresponding to the maximum conversion efficiency values were 427 and 560 nm. The morphologies of the polymers and PC71BM blend films were observed by tapping - mode atomic force microscopy ( AFM ).

Let's think step by step.

1. PFDTBT
2. PFDTBT-based copolymers (generic name)
3. PFDTBT_20Per
4. PFDTBT-10Per
5. PFD2TBT
6. PFD2TBT-based polymers (generic name)
7. PFD2TBT_10Per
8. ITO
9. PEDOT : PSS
10. Polymer (generic name)
11. PC71BM
12. TiO x
13. Al
14. PEDOT : PSS / polymer : PC71BM / LiF devices
15. PEDOT : PSS / polymer : PC71BM / TiO x / Al devices
16. PFDTBT-10Per + PC71BM

These are the material names mentioned in the paragraph.
Please remove irrelevant entities and only keep the entities that clearly refer to Material Name.

Please identify the Values (number + unit) of material properties in the following paragraph.

Even though PFDTBT_20Per showed the highest hole mobility among the PFDTBT - based copolymers , it is UV - visible absorption spectrum showed greater blue - shifting than PFDTBT , as shown in Figures 2 and 3 , and it showed the widest band gap energy among all of the polymers considered herein. The device fabricated using PFDTBT-10Per showed the best photovoltaic performance among the PFDTBT - based polymers ( V oc = 0.74 V , J sc = 7.19 mA / cm^2 , PCE = 2.16% ). For the photovoltaic devices fabricated using PFD2TBT - based polymers , the shortcircuit currents of the devices also increased as the perylene content in the copolymers increased ; however , the PCEs of the devices using PFD2TBT - based polymers were lower than those of PFDTBT - based polymers because of lower open - circuit voltages and short - circuit currents. The device fabricated using PFD2TBT_10Per showed the highest PCE ( 1.51% ) among the PFD2TBT - based polymers. The characteristics of the ITO / 4. Figure 8 shows that the J-V characteristics of ITO / PEDOT : PSS / polymer : PC71BM / TiO x / Al devices provide a similar trend to those of ITO / PEDOT : PSS / polymer : PC71BM / LiF / Al devices but their PCEs increased mainly due to increased short circuit currents. The increase in the short circuit current originates from the introduction of the thin titanium suboxide ( TiO x ) layer ( ca. ∼ 10 nm ). The titanium suboxide layer could block holes to the aluminum electrode , thus it could increase the short circuit current of the photovoltaic device. The device fabricated using PFDTBT-10Per showed the highest PCE of 3.16% with an open circuit voltage of 0.81 V , a short circuit current of 9.61 mA / cm^2 and the highest fill factor ( 0.41 ) among the fabricated devices. The characteristics of the ITO / PEDOT : PSS / polymer : PC71BM / TiO x / Al devices are summarized in Table 5. Figure 9 shows the incident photon - to - current conversion efficiency ( IPCE ) spectra of the ITO / PEDOT : PSS / PFDTBT-10Per + PC71BM / LiF and TiO x / Al devices. The absorption onset corresponding to the photon - to - current conversion efficiency was about 750 nm for these devices , and the absorption onset values corresponding to the maximum conversion efficiency values were 427 and 560 nm. The morphologies of the polymers and PC71BM blend films were observed by tapping - mode atomic force microscopy ( AFM ).

Let's think step by step.

1. PFDTBT-based copolymers:
- PFDTBT: hole mobility = not specified in the text, but mentioned to be higher than PFDTBT_20Per
- PFDTBT_10Per: Voc = 0.74 V, Jsc = 7.19 mA/cm^2, PCE = 2.16%
- PFDTBT_20Per: band gap energy = highest among all polymers considered

2. PFD2TBT-based copolymers:
- PFD2TBT_10Per: PCE = 1.51%

3. ITO / PEDOT : PSS / polymer : PC71BM / TiO x / Al devices:
- Device fabricated using PFDTBT-10Per: PCE = 3.16%, Voc = 0.81 V, Jsc = 9.61 mA/cm^2, fill factor = 0.41
- Absorption onset for ITO / PEDOT : PSS / PFDTBT-10Per + PC71BM / LiF device = about 750 nm
- Absorption onset for ITO / PEDOT : PSS / PFDTBT-10Per + PC71BM / TiO x / Al device = 560 nm (maximum conversion efficiency)

Note:
- The text does not provide the number of perylene units for PFD2TBT_10Per, so we cannot determine its short circuit current.
- The text does not provide the open circuit voltage for the devices fabricated using PFD2TBT-based polymers, so we cannot determine their PCEs.
- The text does not provide the values for the absorption onset corresponding to the maximum conversion efficiency for the ITO / PEDOT : PSS / PFDTBT-10Per + PC71BM / LiF device.
- The text does not provide the values for the morphologies of the polymers and PC71BM blend films in numerical form.
Please remove irrelevant entities and only keep the entities that clearly refer to Value of Material Property.

- PFDTBT: hole mobility
- PFDTBT_10Per: Voc = 0.74 V, Jsc = 7.19 mA/cm^2, PCE = 2.16%
- PFDTBT_20Per: band gap energy
